LayoutNode.Content: MOBILE ACCESSORIES Find lost keys (and phones) with theKeySmart Pro for $40 A great gift for dads and grads, this handy key organizer includes arechargeable Tile tracker. Plus: A cool DJI drone clone! BY RICK BROIDA | MAY 17, 2018 7:20 AM PDT
LayoutNode.SRC:
Mobile Accessories

Find lost keys (and phones) with the KeySmart Pro for $40

A great gift for dads and grads, this handy key organizer includes a rechargeable Tile tracker. Plus: A cool DJI drone clone!

by Rick Broida| May 17, 20187:20 AM PDT

LayoutNode.Content: Normally $60, the Tile-equipped KeySmart Pro is now just $40. KeySmart
LayoutNode.SRC:
Normally $60, the Tile-equipped KeySmart Pro is now just $40.

KeySmart

LayoutNode.Content: again, but the vendor is working to score some additional inventory for Cheapskate readers! It may be a few weeks, but that deal will return. Stay tuned!
LayoutNode.SRC: again, but the vendor is working to score some additional inventory forCheapskate readers! It may be a few weeks, but that deal will return. Staytuned!

LayoutNode.Content: Today's deal is a rerun, but my favorite kind of rerun: Same product, lowerprice.
LayoutNode.SRC: Today's deal is a rerun, but my favorite kind of rerun: Same product, lower price.

LayoutNode.Content: Ever heard of the KeySmart? It's a handy-dandy tool that reduces unwieldykeychains to slim, pocket-friendly carriers.
LayoutNode.SRC: Ever heard of the KeySmart? It's a handy-dandy tool that reduces unwieldy keychains to slim, pocket-friendly carriers.

LayoutNode.Content: keychains -- and using keychains to locate stray phones.
LayoutNode.SRC: keychains -- and using keychains to locate stray phones.

LayoutNode.Content: No-brainer: Why not combine the two? And, lo, theÂ KeySmart Pro Â was born, offering sweet key management with even sweeter Tile tracking baked in.
LayoutNode.SRC: No-brainer: Why not combine the two? And, lo, theÂ KeySmart ProÂ was born,offering sweet key management with even sweeter Tile tracking baked in.

LayoutNode.Content: Cheapskate readers can get aÂ KeySmart Pro for $39.99 shipped . Gift shopping for a dad or grad? Done! Just note that shipping may take 1-2 weeks. Update: I goofed -- shipping is not free, but rather $3. My apologies for the error! Update #2: Use promo code MAYSAVE to bag free shipping!
LayoutNode.SRC: Cheapskate readers can get aÂ KeySmart Pro for $39.99 shipped. Giftshopping for a dad or grad? Done! Just note that shipping may take 1-2weeks. Update: I goofed -- shipping is not free, but rather $3. My apologiesfor the error! Update #2: Use promo code MAYSAVE to bag free shipping!

LayoutNode.Content: The KeySmart part is simple enough, especially for anyone already familiarwith the product: You install your keys in the carrier, adding extensions (notincluded) if needed to accommodate extras. The result is something akin to aSwiss Army knife.
LayoutNode.SRC: The KeySmart part is simple enough, especially for anyone already familiar with the product: You install your keys in the carrier, adding extensions (not included) if needed to accommodate extras. The result is something akin to a Swiss Army knife.

LayoutNode.Content: It comes with a bottle opener that doubles as a loop ring for attaching a carfob, and it has a built-in LED flashlight for good measure.
LayoutNode.SRC: It comes with a bottle opener that doubles as a loop ring for attaching a car fob, and it has a built-in LED flashlight for good measure.

LayoutNode.Content: Can't find your keys? Use the Tile app to locate the KeySmart. Can't find your phone? Double-press the Tile key on the KeySmart and your phone will beep, even if it's on silent mode.
LayoutNode.SRC: Can't find your keys? Use the Tile app to locate the KeySmart. Can't findyour phone? Double-press the Tile key on the KeySmart and your phone willbeep, even if it's on silent mode.

LayoutNode.Content: Now, the problem with pretty much every standalone Tile tracker is that itincorporates a non-removable, non-rechargeable battery -- meaning afterabout a year, you have to buy a replacement. Barf.
LayoutNode.SRC: Now, the problem with pretty much every standalone Tile tracker is that it incorporates a non-removable, non-rechargeable battery -- meaning after about a year, you have to buy a replacement. Barf.

LayoutNode.Content: Hallelujah: The KeySmart Pro is rechargeable, and its battery is good for upto three months, according to the company.
LayoutNode.SRC: Hallelujah: The KeySmart Pro is rechargeable, and its battery is good for up to three months, according to the company.

LayoutNode.Content: includesÂ threeÂ fobs and a couple oversize car keys that just don't fit the KeySmart. He'd be better off with a straight-up Tile.
LayoutNode.SRC: includesÂ threeÂ fobs and a couple oversize car keys that just don't fit theKeySmart. He'd be better off with a straight-up Tile.

LayoutNode.Content: Speaking of which, I'll just add one more thing. Mrs. Cheapskate andCheapskate Jr. both have Tiles, and both love them because they'reconstantly misplacing their phones. But they'll have to be replaced in aboutsix months because of the stupid battery.
LayoutNode.SRC: Speaking of which, I'll just add one more thing. Mrs. Cheapskate and Cheapskate Jr. both have Tiles, and both love them because they're constantly misplacing their phones. But they'll have to be replaced in about six months because of the stupid battery.

LayoutNode.Content: Here you're getting the absolutely essential rechargeable battery, to saynothing of the not-essential-but-still-nice LED flashlight and bottle opener.
LayoutNode.SRC: Here you're getting the absolutely essential rechargeable battery, to say nothing of the not-essential-but-still-nice LED flashlight and bottle opener.

LayoutNode.Content: Thoughts?
heard of theÂ DJI Mavic Pro , the $1,000 quadcopter everyone wants but few can afford? Guess what? There's a clone. Looks like a Mavic Pro. Flies like a Mavic Pro. Pricedlike a DJI Spark. Rcmoment
LayoutNode.SRC:
heard of theÂ DJI Mavic Pro, the$1,000 quadcopter everyonewants but few can afford?Guess what? There's a clone.

Looks like a Mavic Pro. Flies like a Mavic Pro. Priced like a DJI Spark.

Rcmoment

LayoutNode.Content: shipped . That's after applying promo code C8783B Â at the checkout.
LayoutNode.SRC: Obtain F803 (black) for $345 shipped. That's after applying promo code C8783BÂ at the checkout.

LayoutNode.Content: chassis, folding arms, intelligent flight modes, 20-plus minutes of flight time.
LayoutNode.SRC: chassis, folding arms, intelligent flight modes, 20-plus minutes of flight time.

LayoutNode.Content: It flies about the same, too, though its built-in camera tops out at 1080pinstead of 4K, and both the remote and app are different. One big missingfeature? Obstacle avoidance.
LayoutNode.SRC: It flies about the same, too, though its built-in camera tops out at 1080p instead of 4K, and both the remote and app are different. One big missing feature? Obstacle avoidance.

LayoutNode.Content: Also, getting a memory card properly seated is a huge PIA. Guess that's theprice you pay for paying roughly one-third the price. If you've lusted after theMavic Pro but just can't swing it, this is worth a look.
LayoutNode.SRC: Also, getting a memory card properly seated is a huge PIA. Guess that's the price you pay for paying roughly one-third the price. If you've lusted after the Mavic Pro but just can't swing it, this is worth a look.
